result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey J. Purser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Corey J. Purser is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Corey J. Purser was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Sentence to commence forthwith.  *May be served with huber. *May be served in Dodge County.  *Granted good time.
Consecutive to: any other sentence he may be serving
*Submit NDA sample and pay surcharge.  *Payment Plan:  $50.00 per month, commencing on November 1, 2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey J. Purser

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey J. Purser in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Corey J. Purser in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Sentence to commence forthwith
Credit = 22 days
May serve in Dodge County
Good Time
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge  
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on November 1, 2016

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Return date on August 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Return date on September 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Criminal Complaint
- served before court by MASO

Pre-trial conference on September 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Return date on September 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return & pre-trial

Defendant Corey J. Purser in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms the defendant's address.

Atty Hendee requests a $2,500 cash bond and states reasons why.
Defendant states that he is going to be incarcerated in Dodge County for  6 - 8 months so he does not feel that he needs a cash bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $2,500 cash bond with conditions:
*No special conditions  Return date scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
